organic_results.title: Academic studies and technical education: new dimensions of an old struggle in the division of knowledge
organic_results.snippet: The studies emanating from the sociology of education over the past decade, in France at least, have attempted to demonstrate that the school is essentially an instrument participating in the reproduction of relationships between social groups and classes (Baudelot and Establet, 1971; Bourdieu and Passeron, 1970). Most of these studies have therefore taken a macrosociological approach. They have attached scant importance to identifying the processes that produce these societal structures or to exposing the …
